articles.title: Mediator Proposes $20 Million Settlement in Trump’s CBS Lawsuit
articles.description: A mediator has suggested a $20 million settlement in President Donald Trump’s lawsuit against Paramount Global, stemming from a '60 Minutes' interview with then-Vice President Kamala Harris. The proposed terms include a $17 million donation to a Trump-related foundation or museum, payment of legal fees, and public service announcements across Paramount-owned platforms to combat antisemitism. The lawsuit alleges defamation and biased editing by CBS.

articles.title: Massive LGBTQ+ Turnout at Banned Budapest Pride
articles.description: Despite authorities banning the event, tens of thousands attended Budapest Pride on June 28, signaling a sharp rise in protests against Hungary’s restrictive government stance on civil rights.

articles.title: US-China Trade Tensions Escalate
articles.description: The US has imposed fresh curbs on AI chip exports and revoked hundreds of student visas—moves that China calls a 'serious violation' of the Zurich trade truce. In response, China is planning 'firm countermeasures,' according to The Guardian. These developments are sparking fresh uncertainty across global markets.
